narratives.question_text: If a requirement, did this course occur in proper sequence within the School's educational program?  If not, where should it occur?
comments: The course is really great in terms of the freedom to talk about religion and related issues that are usually considered taboo outside of the classroom. It should be available to students on a need basis as it is now.

Considering the fact that religion rarely becomes a part of the main discourse of this School, it was really a valuable course.However, the discussion in the class was sometimes confusing because of the lack of clear directionality.

narratives.question_text: Comment on the body of material presented and the content of the course: sequence, syllabus, and assignments.
comments: It was sad to see the syllabus change within the first few weeks of enrollment. Karla's original plan seemed to have such a coherent direction. To adapt the course to student interest seemed to be a decision for the worse, as students did not know enough about religion and its spatial implications to guide the interest.The course coverage was too broad, and presentations were led by students that didn't have a firm anchor to tie their topics back to. Karla was charged with a difficult assignment of uniting alot of threads of interest in a way where students from diverse backgrounds can converse on some sort of common ground. I understand that the student base was diverse in order to encourage discussion across the diverse approaches towards religion. However, this common ground was frequently not established before discussions can occur.
Everything was clear and useful. Especially, it was worthy that the instructor was trying to shift the course sequence in order to meet individual interest and topic.
The syllabus are continuously modified to suit students' presentation and topic. I think maybe less students' presentations and more instructor's lectures and discussions would be better.

narratives.question_text: What were your expectations for this course and how well were they met?
comments: Since I've visited many religious buildings which were impressive, I expected to discover the relationship between people's minds and spaces. Through various broader topics, I could consider about this topic deeply. Therefore, I think my expectation was met well.
The course went really well I'm quite satisfied with it. I expected more Karla's presentation on August Perre and other modern architecture cases.

narratives.question_text: Comment on the value of this course to you.
comments: To create architecture which provides people with some senses is one of the most important aspects of design, and is needed for current architecture. By considering religious architecture, I could rethink the true meaning of architecture. Also, since students had various background, it was good opportunity to have other view points.
Religion is one of my interested area and the course is perfect for me. I learned a lot from the class and Karla is always helpful as a teacher and discussion leader.

narratives.question_text: Comment on the effectiveness of the teaching by the courses's instructor
comments: Since instructor is knowledgeable on many topics, I could learn various aspects from her. Also she was always trying to combine various topics, which was helpful to consider deeply. Furthermore, she gave me appropriate comments for the paper which helped and encouraged me a lot.
Both instructor and the TA worked very hard and their effort is appreciated. They are effective, generous, and very committed.

narratives.question_text: Suggestions you may have for course improvements:
comments: Although I know it's difficult, it would be better to have smaller group session.
I think maybe the size of the class should be smaller so that student presentations can be limited to an appropriate amount. Other than that, the course is great.
